postcontent:
We have hundreds of other guns currently IN STOCK, and SHIP NATIONWIDE! For a complete listing of my current inventory, and to purchase this and other guns online, please be sure to VISIT US ON THE WEB AT:



TooeleShootingSupply.com



Tooele Shooting Supply just received a shipment of BRAND NEW FIREARMS, including a couple of brand new, factory fresh and hard to find Kahr CW380 sub-compact .380 acp pistols.  These awesome little pistols feature a lightweight polymer frame, stainless steel slide, 2.58 inch barrel, and come complete with a 6-round magazine.



I only have two in stock, and have them priced to sell for just $329.00 each (cash price).

Kahr CW380 Two-Tone .380 ACP Pistol on TooeleShootingSupply.com

The CW380 pistol has a 2.58 inch barrel, an overall length of 4.96 inches and a height of just 3.9 inches. It weighs just 10.2 ounces without a magazine. The pistol has a black polymer frame and features 4140 steel inserts molded into the front and back of the frame for added rigidity. It has a machined, solid 416 matte stainless steel slide and a textured polymer grip.

The Kahr CW380 features a lock breech, modified Browning type recoil lug, and utilizes Kahr’s seven patents including the “safe cam” action found in all Kahr pistols. The result is a micro-compact pistol with very little recoil and quick follow-up shots. The pistol features drift adjustable white bar-dot combat rear sight and pinned-in polymer front sight.

Differences between the Kahr CW380 and Kahr P380 models include: the CW series has a conventional rifled barrel instead of the match grade polygonal barrel found on P models; the CW slide stop lever is MIM (metal-injection-molded) instead of machined; the CW series slide has fewer machining operations, and uses simple roll marking instead of engraved markings; the P380 comes with two magazines, but the CW series comes with one 6 rd steel magazine with flush baseplate. Lastly, the slide locks back after firing the last round – another feature missing on a number of other value-priced compact semi-auto pistols. The durability and reliability of the CW380 model makes it a strong consideration as a backup gun for law enforcement.

Caliber .380 ACP
Capacity 6+1

title: For Sale:  MARLIN MODEL 60  .22 CALIBER SEMI-AUTOMATIC RIFLE
postcontent:
I am selling this Marlin Model 60 as I want to start varmint hunting. This requires a rifle with a longer range than any .22 caliber rifle is capable of.

This rifle was purchased new about 6 months ago and has fired approximately 300 rounds. It has been cleaned every time after a shooting event.

The operators manual specifies .22 caliber long rifle cartridges only as the semi-automatic needs that recoil to operate.

The Marlin Microgroove rifling makes this a very accurate rifle.

Extensive trigger work has been done by a local gunsmith. It has a DIP Inc. M60 Adjustable Trigger Kit and a McCarbo Trigger Spring Kit. The trigger now has a light and short pull. The original factory pull was about 6.5 lbs. and ¼ inch. The pull now is about 2.5 to 3.0 lbs. and 1/8 inch.

The trigger work  (springs and adjustable trigger) cost almost as much as the rifle did when new but has added much value for the serious shooter.

This has the original box and operators manual

This is a sacrifice price as I am asking considerably less than what I have in the rifle. My loss is your gain.

Call with any questions you may have. The price is somewhat negotiable but not much.

The 1301 Competition is Beretta's new gas-operated semi-automatic shotgun designed for 3-Gun and practical shooting. Designed for competition use right out of the box, the 1301 Comp features an oversized charging handle, large bolt release, and extended reversible safety button. To optimize performance, the loading and ejection ports have been increased in size to allow for fast loading and unloading. The BLINK gas operating system, featuring a cross tube gas piston, cycles up to 36% faster than any other shotgun on the market. Available in a 21" or 24" barrel configuration, the barrels utilize the Optima HP interchangeable chokes and feature a stepped rib with mid bead and front fiber optic sight. The receiver is pre-drilled for mounting a rail or other attachment. Our # HG163050, Shoppers please be advised that this revolver will come in a factory cardboard two piece box, not a blue plastic case as the photos show. >>>>>>>>Demand and technology led to the creation of the highly valuable Air Crewman series of light weight revolvers issued to Air Corpsmen during World War II, and popular civilian demand led first to the creation of the steel frame compact Chief's Special .38s after the war, and to the introduction of the Chief's Special Airweight in 1951. The Airweight Chief was available only in nickel, for those desiring a more durable finish, until a limited run of 637 with buffed alloy frames in 1989. By 1996, Smith & Wesson felt the heat from their Brazilian nieces and nephews marketed under the Taurus name, and began regular production of the first variant, 637-1, of the .38 Chiefs Special Ariweight Stainless, with steel barrel and cylinder and specially coated alloy main frame. The reconfigured, strengthened J size frame could also withstand +P ammunition. In 2002, Smith & Wesson added the internal lock, hence the 637-2 numbered model designation. Specs are traditional double- and single-action revolver with 5 shot cylinder capacity. Hammer and trigger are MIM, metal-injected-molded case colored, .312 wide smooth combat trigger and serrated spur hammer, .241 wide by .450 long spur. title: For Sale/Trade:  Sig P220 two-tone-Slide stamped made in Germany
postcontent:
Sig P220 Two-tone, slide stamped Made in Germany. Manufacture date 1998. It is DA/SA and it comes with night sights, two Sig 7-round magazines (the picture shows 4 mags but two were mec-gar and were junk so i sold them off), Hogue grips, Original Sig plastic grips and original screws, and a hard blue case. Im not the original owner so round count is unknown. there surface wear on the barrel from being shot but the inside of the barrel has a mirror like shine to it and there is absolutely no wear on the rails. The slide to frame fit is extremely tight with no play. May have been a police pistol at one point as there does look to be some holster wear on the frame and someone engraved 051 on the inside surface of the slide. The recoil spring is very strong making the slide stiff to pull back. Very accurate pistol. Will ship to an FFL.

I called Sig customer service and they confirmed it was made in 1998, has never been sent back to the Sig, and is not a Sig CPO

Cash price $650.00. Would like to trade for an AR-15, AK-47, 1911 or Glock 30S.

title: For Sale:  AR15 (PSA) Premium M4 Carbine - Brand New
postcontent:
Selling my PSA (Palmetto State Armory) AR15 that I "had to have" but haven't so much as taken it out of the safe since I bought it new. Everything is as it came from the factory: (1) 30 round mag, lock, and owners manual. This rifle is BRAND NEW, completely UNFIRED. Everything included was factory installed and tested, no pieces and parts rifle here...this is the real deal.

As you probably already know, PSA (Palmetto State Armory) is widely considered one of, if not the, best mid-level AR-15 manufactures on the market. These AR's meet or exceed the quality of Colt, Rock River, etc. at a better value. Completely Mil-Spec. Check out the durability test that was done on the PSA AR15 rifle on youtube (link below), it is truly amazing. How many other AR15 rifles you think could pass these tests? 

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=g2rG8xXfDbg


This is the premium model, meaning it has the chrome lined pretty much everything, etc. This rifle has the upgraded ACT (ALG Defence Combat) trigger and fire control group, making the trigger pull much more precision and crisp. The barrel for this firearm is made be FN (the same barrel that is used for the S.A.W. fully auto machine gun that the US Military uses. You can't find a more dependable and quality AR, with this many high end features, anywhere near this price point...period! I have a Colt and a Daniel Defense AR15 as well, and this PSA is easily on par with both these rifles from a quality standpoint.



Price is $850 obo. Remember this rifle is still unfired and has the upgraded trigger and FCG factory installed.

Must be 18 to purchase with valid ID. FTF only, no shipping. CCW owners preferred.



Additional specs on this rifle:

Barrel:  Mil-spec chrome moly vanadium steel, chrome-lined.  Chambered in 5.56 NATO, with a 1/7 twist, M4 barrel extension, and a carbine gas system.   M4 style profile is phosphate coated to mil-specs.  Barrel is High Pressure tested, and Magnetic Particle inspected, to ensure quality and dependability, and is finished off with an F-marked front sight post with sling swivel, and A2 flash hider.

Upper: Forged 7075-T6 A3 AR upper is made to MIL-SPECS and hard coat anodized black for durability. Featuring machined T marks, and a mil-spec finish. These uppers are made for us right here in the USA by a mil-spec manufacturer, and are marked with the Palmetto State Armory logo on the left side, up front, just below the rail.

Bolt: Bolt is made of Mil-spec Carpenter 158 steel, Shot peened, MPI and HPT. Gas key is secured with grade 8 fasteners and staked per mil-spec. Bolt carrier is parkerized outside and chrome lined inside.

Lower:  These forged lowers are quality made using material is 7075-T6 and are marked "MULTI" for caliber.  Finish is Black Hardcoat Anodize per MIL-8625 Type 3 class 2.  Mil-spec-sized buffer tube has 6 adjustment positions, is finished with a Palmetto State Armory M4-style stock.  Standard carbine buffer.

title: For Sale:  MARLIN MODEL 60  .22 CAL. SEMI-AUTOMATIC RIFLE
postcontent:
I am selling this Marlin Model 60 as I want to start varmit hunting. This requires a rifle with a longer range than any .22 caliber rifle is capable of.

This rifle was purchased new about 6 months ago and has fired approximately 300 rounds. It has been cleaned everytime after a shooting event.

The operators manual specifies .22 caliber long rifle cartridges only as the semi-automatic needs that recoil to operate.

The Marlin Microgroove rifling makes this a very accurate rifle.

Extensive trigger work has been done by a local gunsmith. It has a DIP Inc. M60 Adjustable Trigger Kit and a McCarbo Trigger Spring Kit. The trigger now has a light and short pull. The original factory pull was about 6.5 lbs. and ¼ inch. The pull now is about 2.5 to 3.0 lbs. and 1/8 inch.

The trigger work (springs and adjustable trigger cost almost as much as the rifle did when new but has added much value for the serious shooter.

This has the original box and operators manual

This is a sacrifice price as I am asking considerably less than what I have in the rifle.

Call with any questions you may have. The price is somewhat negotiable but not much.

My cellphone number is 816-387-3858 and I can be reached during the day and early evening.

This is an A. Uberti reproduction 1847 COLT WALKER . 44 caliber made in Italy. STEEL FRAME with very nice CASE HARDENING showing. Only the trigger guard and front strap is brass.  It is the Highest Quality of the Walker Reproduction Revolvers.  IT IS A BIG HANDFUL. SAME SIZE, WEIGHT AND LENGTH AS ORIGINAL.  This Uberti  is the FULL SIZE 1847 WALKER, not the smaller Dragoon models that came later for the sissyboys.
Weight 	4.5 lb (2.06 kg)
Length 	15.5 in (394.7 mm)
Caliber 	.44 ball, revolver (.454 in., dia.)
Action 	single-action  

The metal technology used by Uberti is better than the the original Colt version had. I have been a Civil War Reenactor. for 54 years. I started in high school and still participate in the 5th U.S. Artillery. I carried and fired this Walker only a couple times. It is black powder, thus it does NOT have to be registered and can be shipped to you in any state.  I have only used Hogden Pyrodex RS powder to shoot and T-17 products to clean and lube it.  These are the same products I use in my .44 Remington Army black powder revolver and my ORIGINAL Springfield civil war musket and shotgun. (Yes, I regularly shoot the originals).  I shot 12 round balls out of the Walker and found it to be accurate enough to consistently hit a 2 liter jug full of water at 50 yards and it destroyed them!  Other than that I have used it at three reenactments, with Pyrodex, cleaning it immediately afterward.  There is some very faint scratching from being in the safe but it was difficult to make it show up in the photos because it is so faint.  I bought the Walker new.  It has 3 scratches on the bottom of the handle strap (see photo) in the metal.  There were there when I bought it from the dealer several years ago.  It has nice battle scenes engraved on the cylinder, just like the 1847 originals.  The modern stamps from UBERTI are underneath the lever so that they are not normally visible.   The gun looks totally like an 1847 original unless you know to open the lever and look under it.  
From Wikopedia concerning the Colt Walker:
Designer 	Samuel Colt, Captain Samuel Walker
Designed 	1847
Original Manufacturer 	Eli Whitney, Jr. at Whitneyville, Connecticut for Saml. Colt, New York City
Produced 	1847
Number built 	1,100
Variants 	Colt Whitneyville Hartford Dragoon Revolver, quantity about 240
Specifications
\
Muzzle velocity 	1,000-1,200+ feet per second
Effective firing range 	100 yards (91.4 meters)
Feed system 	six-round cylinder
Sights 	blade front sight, hammer notch rear sight The price is $345. I will ship it to you for $25 or you can pick it up in Reston, VA.  I will try to meet you somewhere jointly convenient as I travel about the area, but I will mot drive to Richmond or Philadelphia or like journeys due to price of gas to feed my truck. Let me know where you are and maybe it will fit my wanderings.  Low Ballers will be  ignored.
